entries.powers: Rule over the dead, invisibility (helm of darkness), mineral wealth
entries.physicalDescription: Dark-bearded man often with a scepter and Cerberus
entries.notes: Ruler of the underworld and husband of Persephone; sometimes counted among the Olympians but primarily a chthonic (underworld) deity with distinct cults and attributes.

entries.godOf: Spring, vegetation, queen of the underworld
entries.powers: Control over plant life cycle, queen of the dead
entries.physicalDescription: Young woman often shown with flowers and grain, sometimes with Hades
entries.notes: Daughter of Demeter; her abduction by Hades explains seasonal cycles; central to Eleusinian rites.

entries.powers: Liminal magic, protection of thresholds, guidance in the underworld
entries.physicalDescription: Often depicted holding torches, sometimes triple-formed
entries.notes: Liminal and chthonic goddess associated with magic and crossroads; later syncretized into various cults.

entries.physicalDescription: Somber winged youth or stern figure
entries.notes: Personification of death; brother of Hypnos; distinct from violent death personifications and from Hades.

entries.physicalDescription: Gentle, reclining figure often with wings
entries.notes: Brother of Thanatos; appears in Homeric epics and later poetic traditions.

entries.godOf: Retribution, vengeance for oaths and blood crimes
entries.physicalDescription: Often winged, tormented figures with serpentine hair
entries.notes: Also called Furies; chthonic agents of moral retribution with strong cultic presence.

entries.godOf: River of the underworld, sacred oaths
entries.powers: Binding oaths, guardian of the underworld's river
entries.notes: River-nymph and goddess; riverside oaths sworn by the gods invoked Styx's name.
